en: Whoever comes, I won't let him in.

en: It is not polite to interrupt someone while he is talking.

en: Someone has walked off with my pencil.

en: Somebody has left his hat.

en: Someone is standing behind the wall.

en: Someone leaked the secret to the enemy.

en: Someone stole her money.

en: Someone is standing at the door.

en: Did you see anyone run away?

en: Someone is calling for help.

en: I heard somebody cry out.

en: Someone must have left the water running.

en: Someone must've left the water running.

en: Somebody must've left the water running.

en: I heard someone call my name in the crowd.

en: Someone is shouting for help.

en: Someone beat me to the draw!

en: You might at least have said, "Thank you", when someone helped you.
zh: 人家帮你的时候，你起码得说声谢谢吧。

en: Somebody pushed me in.
zh: 有人把我推了进去。

en: I wasn't conscious of anyone watching me.

en: Someone caught me by the arm.
zh: 有人抓住了我的胳膊。

en: Someone has stolen all my money.

en: I heard someone calling my name.
zh: 我听见有人叫我名字。

en: Someone was calling my name.

en: Two of my books have been taken.
zh: 我有两本书被人拿走了。

en: I felt somebody pat me on the shoulder.
zh: 我感觉到有人拍了下我的肩膀。

en: Someone tapped me on the shoulder.
zh: 有人拍了拍我的肩膀。

en: Someone has taken my shoes by mistake.

en: Somebody has stolen my suitcase.
zh: 有人偷了我的手提箱。

en: Someone broke into my house and ran away with all of my money.
zh: 有人闯进我家把钱全偷跑了。

en: Somebody touched me.

en: Somebody left his umbrella behind.

en: I heard someone whistle.

en: I heard someone call my name from behind.
zh: 我听见有人在后面叫我名字。

en: Someone is knocking loudly at the door.

en: Somebody knocked at the door.

en: Did you hear someone ring the doorbell?

en: Someone must've stolen your watch.
zh: 肯定有人偷了你的表。

en: You must keep the plan secret until someone notices it.
zh: 在被人发现之前，你得对计划保密。

en: It was apparent that someone had taken the money by mistake.
zh: 很明显是有人把钱拿错了。

en: There's somebody coming up the stairs.

en: There's someone coming up the stairs.
zh: 有人上楼了。

en: Someone said something, but I could not understand it.
zh: 有人说了些什么，但我没听懂。

en: I locked the door, in case someone tried to get in.
zh: 我把门锁上了，省得有人想进来。

en: Someone has brought us some grapes.
zh: 有人给我们送了点葡萄。

en: If anyone should phone, say I will be back at one o'clock.
zh: 如果有人打电话来，就说我一点钟回来。

en: Who invented karaoke?
zh: 卡拉OK是谁发明的？

en: Who invented karaoke bars?

en: Someone was coming!
zh: 有人来了！

en: Someone came.
zh: 有人来了。

en: I heard someone call my name.
zh: 我听见有人叫我名字。

en: When someone becomes neurotic about pens and paper clips, it's a sure sign they're cracking up.
zh: 如果一个人开始对笔和回形针都神经兮兮的，那肯定说明他快崩溃了。

en: I heard someone knocking.
zh: 我听见有人敲门。

en: Someone must have left the door open.
zh: 肯定是谁没关门。

zh: 肯定是有人没关门。

zh: 绝对是有人没关门。

en: Someone knocked on the door.
zh: 有人敲了门。

en: Somebody must break the sad news to her mother.

en: Someone made a threat to kill that politician.
zh: 有人威胁要杀了那个政客。

en: Someone set fire to the house.
zh: 有人放火烧了房子。

en: Somebody has broken this dish.
zh: 有人把盘子打了。

en: Someone left a burning cigarette on the table.

en: We heard someone go upstairs.
zh: 我们听见有人上楼了。

en: The entire theater turned to chaos when somebody cried "Fire!".
zh: 有人喊了声“着火了”，剧场里立刻乱成一团。

en: Somebody could exchange a sheep or a horse, for example, for anything in the marketplace that they considered to be of equal value.
zh: 比如，人们可以用羊或者马在市场上换取任何他们觉得等值的东西。

en: Who will play the role of the princess?
zh: 谁来演公主？

en: Is anybody here?

en: Anybody here?

en: Anybody in here?

en: Is there anyone here?
zh: 这儿有人吗？

en: Is someone there?

en: Is anyone around?

en: Is there anybody here?

en: Is anybody in there?
zh: 里面有人吗？

en: Is anybody there?
zh: 那儿有人吗？

en: Is anyone here?
zh: 这儿有人吗？

en: Who telephoned Ann?

en: Who discovered America?
zh: 谁发现了美洲？

en: Do you know who is looking at that picture?
zh: 你知道谁在看那张画吗？

en: Who can run fastest in your class?
zh: 你们班谁跑得最快？

en: Who will succeed to your father's business?
zh: 谁会接手你父亲的生意？

en: Who told you to write with your left hand?
zh: 谁教你用左手写字的？

en: Who is the tallest of the five?
zh: 这五个人里谁最高？

en: Who sent me a wire?
zh: 谁给我打的电报？

en: Mr Tani and his wife were present at that party.
zh: 谷先生和他太太出席了那个聚会。

en: Mr. Tani and his wife were present at that party.
zh: 谷先生和他太太出席了那个聚会。

en: Mr Tani is not so much a scholar as a journalist.
zh: 与其说谷先生是个学者，不如说他是个记者。

en: The valley echoed with his call.
zh: 山谷里回荡着他的呼喊声。

en: The valley echoes the sound of the waterfall.
zh: 山谷里回响着瀑布的声音。

en: The valley was aflame with red and yellow leaves.
zh: 山谷里到处是红叶和黄叶，美得像着了火一样。

en: The valley narrows 500 feet ahead.
zh: 前面500英尺处山谷变窄了。

en: A river runs down through the valley.
zh: 一条河从山谷中流过。

en: The valley was dotted with farm houses.
zh: 山谷里散布着一些农舍。

en: The valley was starred with yellow flowers.
zh: 山谷里点缀着黄色的花朵。

en: Clear off the shelf, and you can put your books there.
zh: 把架子清理干净，你就可以把书放那儿了。

en: Can't you reach the book on the shelf?
zh: 你够不着架子上的那本书吗？

en: What are the measurements of the shelf?
zh: 这个架子的尺寸是多少？

en: Can you reach the box on that shelf?
zh: 你能碰到那个架子上的盒子吗？

en: Can you reach the top shelf?

en: There is an album on the shelf.
zh: 架子上有一本相册。

en: This is what they call a lucky break.
zh: 这就是所谓的运气好。

en: The escaped prisoner is still at large.
zh: 那个逃犯还在潜逃。

en: The escaped prisoner hasn't been caught yet.
zh: 那个逃犯还没被抓到。

en: A hunt is on for the runaway.
zh: 正在搜捕那个逃犯。

en: The escaped robber is still at large.
zh: 那个在逃的强盗还没落网。

en: I'm worried she'll dehydrate.
zh: 我担心她会脱水。

en: Bite down on the cotton roll.
zh: 咬住这个棉球。

en: Let's fly kites.
zh: 我们去放风筝吧。

en: Let's fly a kite.
zh: 我们去放风筝吧。

en: Few, if any, Americans grasped the significance of what had been accomplished.
zh: 几乎没有美国人意识到这项成就的重大意义。

en: Flying kites can be dangerous.
zh: 放风筝可能会有危险。

en: The kite soared upwards with the swiftness of a bird.
zh: 风筝像鸟儿一样飞快地升向高空。

en: There is a kite flying above the tree.

en: The nursery toilet door was shut.
zh: 育儿室厕所的门关着。

en: Would you page Mr Sawada?

en: To read a lot of books is a good thing.
zh: 多读书是一件好事。

en: Reading a lot of books is a good thing.
zh: 多读书是一件好事。

zh: 许多人聚集在皇宫前。

en: There're many rich Americans. On the other hand some Americans are very poor.
zh: 美国有很多富人，但另一方面，有些美国人也非常穷。

en: I'd like to play a game of ping-pong.
zh: 我想打场乒乓球。

en: A waterfall of sweat began to pour down my face.
zh: 我脸上的汗哗哗地往下流，跟瀑布似的。

en: The hawk has piercing eyes.
zh: 老鹰的眼睛非常锐利。

en: We became Americanized after World War II.
zh: 二战以后，我们就美国化了。

en: World War II ended in 1945.
zh: 二战是在1945年结束的。

en: The Second World War broke out in 1939.

en: It was in 1939 that the Second World War broke out.
zh: 第二次世界大战是在1939年爆发的。

en: World war two broke out in 1939.

en: Your second child is a boy? Lucky you! Things are going according to the saying - Have a girl first and a boy next.
zh: 老二是个男孩？你真有福气！正所谓“先开花后结果”。

en: The second language may be freely chosen.
zh: 第二外语可以自由选择。

en: Let's take up the second problem, shall we?
zh: 咱们来看第二个问题，好吗？

en: In the second place, if we do not go, someone else will read the inscription on the stone and find happiness, and we shall have lost it all.
zh: 其次，如果我们不去，别人就会读到石碑上的文字并找到幸福，那我们就全失去了。

en: Secondly, some of the Creoles may become independent "national languages" in their own right.
zh: 其次，一些克里奥尔语可能会独立成为“民族语言”。

en: The second is the affinity with environment. By utilizing natural energy and reducing wastes, we have to make houses which harmonize with ecology.
zh: 第二是与环境的亲和力。通过利用自然能源和减少浪费，我们必须建造与生态和谐相处的房屋。

en: In the fourth place, even if we succeeded in carrying off the bear cubs, we could not run up a mountain without stopping to rest.
zh: 第四，就算我们成功带走了小熊崽，也不可能不休息就一口气跑上山。

en: In the fourth place, I do not want people to think that I am afraid of anything.
zh: 第四，我不希望别人觉得我什么都怕。

en: A potential third party would not be able to crack the code.
zh: 第三方是破解不了这个密码的。

en: Thirdly, if you don't put in the effort and challenge difficult things, there is nothing in the world at which you will succeed.
zh: 第三，如果你不努力去挑战难题，那这世上就没有你能成功的事。

en: Let's begin with the first chapter.
zh: 咱们从第一章开始吧。

en: World War I broke out in 1914.
zh: 一战是在1914年爆发的。

en: Soon after the end of World War 1, people never thought such a hateful and cruel war would break out again.
zh: 一战结束后不久，人们压根儿没想到还会再爆发一场这么可恨、这么残酷的战争。

en: Don't give in to despair just because you didn't get into the college that was at the top of your wish-list.
zh: 别因为没考上第一志愿的大学就灰心丧气。

en: Corporate earnings for the first quarter were disappointing.
zh: 第一季度的公司收益挺令人失望的。

en: The first impression is most lasting.

en: First impressions are important.

en: The first violins carry the melody.
zh: 第一小提琴声部负责主旋律。

en: We have managed to overcome the first obstacle.
zh: 我们总算克服了第一个障碍。

en: In the first place they must have some dinner.
zh: 首先，他们得吃点晚饭。

en: To begin with, you must not be late for school.
zh: 首先，你上学不能迟到。

en: First of all, I want to tell you this.
zh: 首先，我想告诉你这件事。

en: In the first place, we must be careful about what we eat and drink.
zh: 首先，我们必须注意饮食健康。

en: First, they should have right ideas of things, ideas that are based on careful observation, and understand causes of effects and their significance correctly.
zh: 首先，他们应该对事物有正确的认识，这些认识应基于细致的观察，并正确理解因果关系及其意义。

en: To begin with, she is too young.
zh: 首先，她年纪太小了。

en: In the first place, no harm will come to us even if we try.
zh: 首先，就算我们试一试，也不会有什么坏处。

en: Firstly, it is a matter of justice.
zh: 首先，这是一个公义的问题。

en: First we have International English, which will probably become simpler than "standard."
zh: 首先是国际英语，它可能会比“标准英语”更简单。

en: Tell me the name of the ninth month.
zh: 告诉我九月叫什么名字。

en: Article 6. The president shall preside at all meetings.
zh: 第六条：总裁应主持所有会议。

en: Let's review Lesson 5.
zh: 咱们复习一下第五课。

en: GNP increased at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 4.5% in the fourth quarter.
zh: 第四季度国民生产总值经季节调整后的年增长率为4.5%。

en: Fourth, my homeroom class in Japan included students of a wide range of abilities.
zh: 第四，我在日本教的班里，学生们的水平参差不齐。

en: The issue of Third World poverty is very pressing.
zh: 第三世界的贫困问题非常紧迫。

en: I wonder if a third world war will break out.
zh: 我在想，会不会爆发第三次世界大战。

en: A loss in third-quarter revenues was predicted.
zh: 预计第三季度的收入会有亏损。

en: The third quarter GNP growth was 1% over the preceding quarter.
zh: 第三季度国民生产总值比上一季度增长了1%。

en: Let's read Lesson 3.
zh: 咱们来读一下第三课。

en: Let's turn back to the third lesson.
zh: 咱们翻回到第三课吧。

en: Let's begin with Lesson 3.
zh: 咱们从第三课开始。

en: The third point to make is that Emmet attempted to harmonize his theory with the reality of designing.
zh: 第三点是，埃梅特试图让他的理论与设计现实相协调。

en: The second man was a Spanish explorer.
zh: 第二个人是个西班牙探险家。

en: Halfway through the second chapter I realized I hadn't taken anything in.
zh: 第二章读了一半，我才发现自己一点也没看进去。

en: World War II was carried on until 1945.
zh: 二战一直持续到1945年。

en: Father told me that World War II ended in 1945.
zh: 我爸跟我说二战是1945年结束的。

en: The Second World War began in 1939.
zh: 第二次世界大战是1939年爆发的。

en: It has been almost 50 years since World War II ended.
zh: 二战结束已经快50年了。

en: When did World War II break out?
zh: 二战是什么时候爆发的？

en: The second quarter GNP growth was higher than predicted.
zh: 第二季度的国民生产总值增长比预期的要高。

en: Lesson Two is easy.
zh: 第二课挺简单的。

en: Second, smokers persuade themselves that there is nothing they can do about smoking anyway.
zh: 其次，吸烟的人总会劝自己说，反正也戒不掉。

en: Ten games were played on the first day.
zh: 第一天打了十场比赛。

en: In the First World War, a large proportion of England's young men enlisted.
zh: 一战的时候，英国很大一部分年轻人都参军了。

en: There were five classes in the first year.
zh: 一年级有五个班。

en: Mass production reduced the price of many goods.
zh: 大规模生产降低了很多商品的价格。

en: I have to type in a really big document.
zh: 我得录入一份特别长的文档。

en: Large amounts of timber are used in paper making.
zh: 造纸需要用大量的木材。

en: There's a volcano emitting masses of smoke in Iceland.
zh: 冰岛有个火山正冒着滚滚浓烟。

en: The quantity discounts are according to the size of the order.
zh: 批量折扣是根据订货量来定的。

en: A big tear rolled down my cheek.
zh: 一大滴眼泪顺着我的脸颊流了下来。

en: Tears rolled down her cheeks.
zh: 眼泪顺着她的脸颊流了下来。

en: Flight across the continent was still a daring venture.
zh: 飞越大陆在当时依然是一个大胆的冒险。

en: Grasp all, lose all.
zh: 贪多必失。

en: The ocean floor is being studied by some scientists.
zh: 一些科学家正在研究海底。

en: I will look the other way.
zh: 我会看向别处的。

en: Tall trees catch much wind.
zh: 树大招风。

en: We took refuge behind a big tree.
zh: 我们躲到了一棵大树后面。

en: A big tree has fallen in the storm.
zh: 暴风雨里倒了一棵大树。

en: The game lacked excitement.
zh: 比赛不够精彩。

en: Kazuo is an ambitious young man.
zh: 和夫是个很有抱负的年轻人。

en: The cannon went off by accident.
zh: 大炮不小心走火了。

en: It's making a great stir.
zh: 这事儿引起了不小的轰动。

en: I'm too busy. I can't take on any new work.
zh: 我太忙了，接不了新活了。

en: To my great sorrow, my father died young.
zh: 让我非常难过的是，我父亲很年轻就去世了。

en: It is such warm weather that the roses will bloom soon.
zh: 天气这么暖和，玫瑰花很快就要开了。

en: I met so many people that I do not even remember their faces.
zh: 我见了太多人，连长相都记不住了。

en: I am very sorry that I have to ask you to change the meeting date to March 6 due to personal reasons.
zh: 实在抱歉，因为个人原因，我得把会议日期改到3月6号。

en: I imagine that you went through a lot of difficulties.
zh: 我能想象你经历了不少困难。

en: It has become very cold.
zh: 天气变得好冷。

en: I am very sorry to inform you that she died.
zh: 很遗憾地通知你，她去世了。

en: Great effort was one factor in his success.
zh: 努力是他成功的一个因素。

en: The fat will be in the fire.
zh: 这下要出乱子了。

en: Our water supply is very short.
zh: 我们的供水非常紧张。

en: Whenever you're in trouble or feeling down, I'll be there for you.
zh: 无论你遇到什么困难或者心情不好，我都会在你身边。

en: My goodness! I have lost the car keys.
zh: 天哪！我把车钥匙弄丢了。

en: Oh, no! My passport is gone!
zh: 糟了！我护照不见了！

en: It was such a lovely day that everybody was feeling happy and cheerful.
zh: 天气这么好，大家心情都很舒畅。

en: I am sorry to trouble you so much.
zh: 很抱歉给你添了这么大麻烦。

en: I'm sorry to have caused you such inconvenience.
zh: 给您带来不便，我很抱歉。

en: I appreciate that you are very fatigued.
zh: 我能体谅你现在非常疲惫。

en: Thank you very much for all you have done.
zh: 非常感谢你为我做的一切。

en: You have been really good to me.

zh: 一根大柱子挡住了看湖的视线。

en: A big spider was spinning a web.
zh: 一只大蜘蛛正在织网。

en: A big typhoon is coming on.
zh: 大台风要来了。

en: A big typhoon is approaching.
zh: 一个大台风正在靠近。

en: A loud noise made him jump.
zh: 一声巨响让他吓得跳了起来。

en: A big ship appeared on the horizon.
zh: 地平线上出现了一艘大船。

en: A big ship is anchored near here.
zh: 附近停泊着一艘大船。

en: A broad river runs through the city.
zh: 一条宽阔的河流穿过这座城市。

en: Raise a loud voice, then all goes wrong.
zh: 大声嚷嚷的话，事情就全搞砸了。

en: Snow fell in large flakes.
zh: 雪落得很大，大朵大朵的。

en: Please speak in a loud voice.
zh: 请大声点说话。

en: Can you talk louder? I didn't hear you.
zh: 你能大声点吗？我没听清。

en: Don't raise your voice at me.
zh: 别对我大声嚷嚷。

en: Say it clearly in a loud voice.
zh: 大声点，说清楚。

en: Speak clearly and make yourself heard.
zh: 说清楚点，让大家能听见。

en: Speak up, and speak clearly.
zh: 大声点说，说清楚。

en: Could you speak up? I can't hear you.
zh: 你能大声点吗？我听不见。

en: Big successes result from constant effort.
zh: 巨大的成功源于不断的努力。

en: A big car drew up and a tall lady got out.
zh: 一辆大车停了下来，一个高个子女士走了出来。

en: The big car pulled up suddenly.
zh: 那辆大车突然停了下来。

en: Better be the head of a cat than the tail of a lion.
zh: 宁为鸡头，不为凤尾。

en: Big events will come to pass.
zh: 会有大事发生的。

en: The king left a large fortune behind.
zh: 国王留下了巨额财产。

en: I saw a big dog lying in front of Mr Hill's house.
zh: 我看见希尔先生家门口趴着一条大狗。

en: I saw a big dog lying in front of Mr. Hill's house.
zh: 我看见希尔先生家门口趴着一条大狗。

en: A man with a big dog came in.
zh: 一个牵着大狗的人进来了。

en: A big dog is always beside him.
zh: 他身边总有一条大狗跟着。

en: The big building was blazing with lights.
zh: 那座大楼灯火辉煌。

en: I want to buy a large sized refrigerator.
zh: 我想买个大号冰箱。

en: He was calm in the face of great danger.
zh: 他在巨大的危险面前表现得很冷静。

en: A big rock stuck out from the bank into the river.
zh: 岸边有一块大石头伸进了河里。

en: There's a big sign.
zh: 那儿有个大牌子。

en: A big rock rose out of the sea.
zh: 海里冒出了一块大石头。

en: I have a lot of baggage, so I can't walk home.
zh: 我行李太多了，没法走回家。

en: Large houses are expensive to live in.
zh: 住大房子开销很大。

en: Large houses are not necessarily comfortable to live in.
zh: 大房子住着不一定舒服。

en: I was suddenly awakened by a loud noise.
zh: 我突然被一声巨响吵醒了。

en: I was rudely awakened by a loud noise.
zh: 我被一阵巨响给惊醒了。

en: It rang loudly.
zh: 响声很大。

en: It has a big whirlpool and a strong current.
zh: 那儿有个大漩涡，水流很急。

en: It sometimes is the case that there is a lot of disagreement.
zh: 有时候确实会有很大的分歧。

en: They say that a huge dam will be built.
zh: 听说要建个巨大的水坝。

en: They say that a large dam will be built.
zh: 听说要建个大水坝。

en: If you stay at a big hotel, you can use their swimming pool.
zh: 你要是住大酒店，就能用他们的游泳池。

en: We have a big supermarket.
zh: 我们这儿有个大超市。

en: There is a large supermarket.
zh: 那儿有个大超市。

en: A big canoe was cutting through the water.
zh: 一只大独木舟正划破水面。

en: The big oak tree breaks the force of the wind.
zh: 那棵大橡树挡住了风。

en: I never drink unless there's a big event of some kind.
zh: 除非有大事，否则我从来不喝酒。

en: It's too loud.
zh: 声音太大了。

en: It's too big.
zh: 太大了。

en: It's too large.
zh: 太大了。

en: I am going to return this sweater because it's too big.
zh: 这件毛衣太大了，我要去退掉。

en: The house is not impressive if you're thinking of size.
zh: 单论面积的话，这房子没什么特别的。

en: Eat your vegetables so that you will grow up to be big and strong.
zh: 多吃蔬菜，以后才能长得高大强壮。

en: What are you going to be when you grow up?
zh: 你长大以后想做什么？

en: What're you going to be when you grow up?
zh: 你长大以后想当什么？

en: When I grow up, I want to be an English teacher.
zh: 我长大以后想当英语老师。

en: I want to be somebody when I grow up.
zh: 我长大以后想出人头地。

en: How you've grown!
zh: 你都长这么大了！

en: He was big and slow and silent.
zh: 他身材高大，动作迟缓，而且不爱说话。
